name: hc_wastewater_h2s_fz
description: [HC] H2S wastewater + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK (zinc attacked), suggest SF
query: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

turns.content: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

This GDB filter housing configuration for your wastewater plant exhaust is blocked. The presence of H2S / Hydrogen Sulfide Corrosion and Chemical Vapor Exposure means that the requested GDB housing with FZ (C3) material is unsuitable. The housing corrosion class is C2.The GDB housing also uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for a wastewater environment. A solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation, using a material with corrosion class C5 or higher, and provide activated carbon adsorption to remove chemical vapors. Unfortunately, no standard catalog product currently satisfies all of these requirements simultaneously. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies a critical engineering mismatch. It accurately pulls data from the PDF regarding the GDB housing's corrosion class (C2) and construction (single-wall), and correctly applies HVAC engineering principles to determine that galvanized steel is unsuitable for a wastewater environment containing H2S. The recommendation to seek custom engineering for a C5-rated carbon solution is the safest and most professional advice given the catalog limitations.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as C2 and single-wall (PDF p.8) and correctly assesses FZ as unsuitable for H2S environments.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the user's request, explains why it is rejected, and provides the necessary requirements for a valid solution (C5 material, carbon filtration).
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety block; installing galvanized steel in an H2S environment would lead to rapid corrosion and failure.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional, direct, and authoritative regarding the technical constraints.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear logical progression: H2S requires high corrosion resistance -> GDB is C2/Galvanized -> Configuration blocked.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to engineering best practices for corrosion protection and application suitability.

strengths: Accurate distinction between material raw rating (FZ=C3 on p.4) and product rating (GDB=C2 on p.8)
Sound engineering judgment regarding H2S corrosion risks
Correct identification that GDB is not suitable for gas-phase filtration requirements

openai.explanation: The system correctly blocks galvanized (FZ) GDB for an H2S wastewater exhaust on corrosion grounds, but it makes incorrect claims about GDB‚Äôs construction and suitability criteria (leakage/hygiene) and misses viable catalog pathways (e.g., carbon housings GDC/GDC FLEX or alternative materials). The recommendation to contact technical support is safe but overly dismissive given available product families in the provided catalog excerpt.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDB is an indoor duct filter housing and is commonly supplied in FZ with corrosion class C2 (GDB page), but the system‚Äôs claim that GDB is ‚ÄúSINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED‚Äù and that it ‚Äúdoes not meet leakage class‚Äù is not supported (GDB is tested to EN 15727/EN 1886 and has an insulated service door), while the corrosion reasoning (H2S + FZ unsuitable) is sound engineering practice.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It blocks the requested configuration but fails to propose a concrete alternative from the catalog (e.g., GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX for carbon media, or specifying ZM/RF/SF options) and does not ask for key parameters (airflow, size, indoor/outdoor, required removal efficiency).
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately flags corrosion risk with H2S and avoids recommending FZ in a harsh chemical environment, steering toward higher corrosion class materials and specialist review.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional, clear, and appropriately cautious for a technical sales/engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The corrosion logic is reasonable, but the argument mixes in questionable assertions about hygiene/leakage requirements for wastewater exhaust and concludes ‚Äúno standard product‚Äù without checking adjacent catalog families intended for chemical media.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly rejects GDB+FZ for H2S exposure, but it over-constrains by implying no catalog solution exists despite the catalog including carbon/patron housings (GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX) and higher-corrosion materials being listed generally.

strengths: Correctly prioritizes corrosion risk and blocks a likely short-life galvanized solution in H2S service.
Maintains a professional, safety-first recommendation path (custom engineering/technical support).
weaknesses: Incorrect/unsupported product characterization: GDB is not simply uninsulated single-wall in the way stated, and it is tested for leakage/bypass per EN 15727/EN 1886.
Misses obvious catalog alternatives for chemical adsorption (GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX) and does not gather sizing/flow details before concluding no standard product fits.
pdf_citations: GDB: described as a duct filter housing for bag/compact filters, for indoor use, commonly manufactured in FZ with corrosion class C2; tested for leakage/bypass per EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007 (GDB section/table in provided PDF images).
GDC: described as a patron filter housing for carbon or chemical media with recommended flow e.g., 600x600 has 16 patrons and Rek. fl√∂de 2000 m¬≥/h (GDC table in provided PDF images).

content_segments.text: This GDB filter housing configuration for your wastewater plant exhaust is blocked. The presence of

content_segments.inference_logic: H2S (hydrogen sulfide) aggressively attacks zinc coatings. FZ (C3 galvanized) corrodes rapidly in H2S environments. Minimum C5 material required (RF or SF).
Gas/odor/VOC removal requires activated carbon adsorption. Mechanical filters cannot capture gas-phase contaminants.

A solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation, using a material with corrosion class C5 or higher, and provide activated carbon adsorption to remove chemical vapors. Unfortunately, no standard catalog product currently satisfies all of these requirements simultaneously.
